qas.question: What is the name of Thammasat University's engineering school?
What is Thailand's only government-established and owned institute of technology?
What year was Suranaree University of Technology founded?
What is the name of the best-known private institute of technology in Thailand?

context: Institutes of technology with different origins are Asian Institute of Technology, which developed from SEATO Graduate School of Engineering, and <a0_0>Sirindhorn International Institute of Technology<a0_0/>, an engineering school of Thammasat University. <a1_0>Suranaree University of Technology<a1_0/> is the only government-owned technological university in Thailand that was established (<a2_0>1989<a2_0/>) as such; while <a3_0>Mahanakorn University of Technology<a3_0/> is the most well known private technological institute. Technology/Technical colleges in Thailand is associated with bitter rivalries which erupts into frequent off-campus brawls and assassinations of students in public locations that has been going on for nearly a decade, with innocent bystanders also commonly among the injured and the military under martial law still unable to stop them from occurring.
